>So said Ilja Preuss on 2003-08-07 --------------------
>J. B. Rainsberger =
wrote:
>> I am looking for opinions on the pro side of using inner
>> class=
es to test the private parts of a class. Since I don't
>> use the technique=
 myself, I don't know whether there is any
>> advantage to this technique, =
other than it works. (I could
>> also use JUnitX without cluttering up my s=
ource code.)
>
>To me, cluttering up the source code *is* an advantage in t=
his case.
>Testing private parts is a smell - if I need to do it, I want th=
e smell
>to be felt every time I need to work with it, I want it to be ugly=
.

Agreed, however if you assume that testing private parts is a necessity,=
 then cluttering up the source code is not good. The necessity comes from t=
he desire to add tests to legacy code to aid in refactoring.

Given that, a=
ny further comments?
